item.title: Fallout Shelter is Getting a Reality Show Adaptation, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
If you thought the Fallout television show wasn’t enough and you wanted more live-action adaptations, you won’t have to wait too long. It has just been claimed that Prime is assembling a new reality show (‘MrBeast style’) that will plant contestants in a live-action representation of Fallout Shelter.

It has been reported that production will start in 2026, and that those taking part in the show will need to build and manage their own vault, keeping their vault dwellers ‘alive’.

Mixed Responses Surface About the Fallout Shelter Show

In an exclusive report from Jeff Sneider, it was claimed that Prime is working on a Fallout Shelter reality show produced by Jonathan Nolan, executive producer on the core Fallout show.

Last year, Fallout emerged in live-action form with an all-new television series tied into the game’s central universe. With an original story, Bethesda Game Studios, Prime Video, and Kilter concocted an authentic representation of the post-apocalyptic world that millions of fans know and love.

It seems that the teams involved aren’t content with just that show, as another one is claimed to be in the works.

Working with a ‘Squid Game’ or ‘MrBeast’ operating model, it seems that Prime Video is eager to assemble a Fallout Shelter adaptation. The purported show will see contestants build and run their own vaults, which are pivotal to the story in the Fallout franchise.

In these vaults, survivors live underground and outlast the nuclear annihilation of the world above, but it’s unlikely Amazon will green-light the destruction of the planet to accommodate a Fallout Shelter show.

Let’s hope not, anyway.

Fallout’s second season is unravelling as we speak, with the second episode having dropped yesterday, December 23. It’s an award-winning series with a brilliant cast, and it’s well worth a watch.

Would you want to compete in a Fallout Shelter reality show? Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news about the recent PlayStation Network hacking incident

item.title: Insider Gaming’s Best Indie Game of the Year 2025
item.content:encoded:
Indie games are more important than ever. With the AAA market experiencing a mix of results and more layoffs than ever, it may be safer to lean toward indie development. It’s worked out for many of the world’s best titles, and Insider Gaming’s 2025 Indie Game of the Year highlights why.

The lines between an Indie game and AA or even AAA titles are becoming more blurred by the second. Some releases appear to have been created by a single person—which is often the case, as seen with LocalThunk’s Balatro—whereas others seem like premium, high-priced packages. From Schedule 1 to Ball X Pit, this list has picked out the best Indie games of 2025, and there’s one winner.

Best Indie Game Of 2025 Winner—Hollow Knight: Silksong

It would be remiss if Insider Gaming didn’t clarify two things: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 hasn’t made this list, as the budget and development team (which is obviously more than the originally claimed 30 people) does not classify to IG as ‘indie,’ and the other point being that this award could’ve gone to one of two games, quite easily.

That being said, Hornet gets to wear the silky crown! Team Cherry’s Silksong never quite hit the ridiculous GTA 6 levels of hype, but there’s probably no indie game in history that garnered as much attention, anticipation, wishlists, and topped virtually any other metric for an upcoming indie title. Hollow Knight: Silksong had to be as good, if not surpass, than the immense legacy of the original Hollow Knight.

Siliksong is a technical and entertainment masterpiece from start to finish. It still edges out Ori for the most incredible environmental design, and the combat and exploration mechanics have gone up a notch. Boss battles are electric, and there’s an ever-present danger wherever you go. The almost shameless ceiling of difficulty is never masked at any point, but you’re rewarded for your perseverance and persistence with secret areas, enchanting NPCs, and side quests.

With the Sea of Sorrow DLC on the way, enhancing an already criminally low price point, Silksong is a sumptuous banquet of indie excellence.

Best Indie Game of 2025 Nominations

Hades 2

We said this award could’ve gone either way, and Hades 2 will be many people’s pick for Indie GOTY, and rightly so. Supergiant Games already has a GOTY award in the trophy cabinet thanks to the original Hades. This put a burden on the sequel’s shoulders that even Zeus might struggle to shoulder. Thanks to early access (which played a small part in this decision), Hades 2 has taken an already solid foundation, updated it, and tweaked it into a Herculean-looking work of art.

You might not be able to go back to Hades 1 after playing the follow-up! With the added diversity of going above ground as well as slaying below it, and more Boons and combat systems to consider, Hades 2 is a more than worthy successor, and rightly took its place alongside Silksong in the overall The Game Awards 2025 GOTY nominees.

Ball X Pit

If you’ve not heard of Ball X Pit, you need to; if you have played it, it’s SO good, isn’t it? Ball X Pit doesn’t require inch-perfect timing, lightning-quick reflexes, and its skill ceiling isn’t outrageous. This is easily one of the most chill games of 2025, and it’s another roguelike. You can comfortably sit back and relax for most of your runs, and all you need to do is just move the left analog stick around. But your progress is determined by your on-the-fly decision-making when it comes to Balls and Passive Abilities.

Ball X Pit might not seem skillful at first, but it can take a few in-game hours to understand the nuances of the gameplay: How to angle your shots, where to concentrate your attacks, which synergies are superior, and how to make the game’s most broken combinations. It has one of the best soundtracks of 2025, and you’ll have a ball playing it.

Blue Prince

In terms of methodical pacing, nothing comes close to Blue Prince. Every move and decision you make is taken one room at a time as you seek to find Room 46—if it even exists. This is the third of four roguelikes on this list—is the industry trying to tell us something? You have a limited amount of time to map out a route in your inherited house to find Room 46.

Along the way are key items that you can use on subsequent runs to make more progress, discover, and solve more mysteries. The idea is to repeat this process repeatedly, as it all helps you to eventually find Room 46. Its masterful environmental storytelling and intrinsic gameplay and teachings make this an easy-to-pick-up and play game. Wonderfully atmospheric and ever-intriguing, the punny-named Blue Prince (Blueprints?) has earned its place.

Did any shooter that’s not Battlefield 6 get your vote for best shooter of 2025? Is it something that didn’t even make it onto our list, like a certain Black Ops 7? Be sure to let IG know through the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Also, check out the best PC Gaming Accessories of 2025, as well as the 5 best games like Escape From Tarkov.

item.title: Wishing You A Merry Christmas From Insider Gaming
item.content:encoded:
With 2025 coming to a close, the team at Insider Gaming wants to wish you all a Merry Christmas and a happy and healthy New Year.

Our team is taking a well-deserved break to end the year, and will return in full on Monday, January 5. In the meantime, there is plenty of content coming to the site over the next couple of weeks ranging from the results of the Insider Gaming Community Awards to year-in-review features and more.

Of course, should anything major break that needs coverage, we will bring it to you with the same speed and quality that Insider Gaming has become known for.

A Sincere Thank You

As we wind down 2025, we want to leave you with our sincerest thanks. Insider Gaming has only been around since 2022, and this year has been far and away our best year yet. And that’s all thanks to you, our dedicated readers.

Your support has made us one of the fastest-growing independent gaming media outlets. Whether it’s been reading our stories, watching our shows, participating in our community Discord, and even taking our surveys to help shape our future, everything you’ve done has helped turn Insider Gaming into what it is today.

And we can’t forget to talk about the biggest accomplishment of the year, the release of the Insider Gaming App. Since our launch, an app was one of the of the most requested things in our yearly reader surveys. You wanted a way to get your information in a quick and clean matter, and that’s what we brought you this year.

The free Insider Gaming App’s launch on iOS and Android has been nothing short of mind blowing. We had our goals of where we wanted to be with it by the end of the year, and you blew that out of the water. Again, thank you!

And lastly, to our Insider Gaming Premium and Premium Plus members. Running an independent gaming outlet in this era is hard of closures and consolidations is hard. To be honest, we were nervous about launching any sort of premium plan. But you all showed up and showed your support in a way that we couldn’t even have imagined. We can’t overstate just how much it means to us that you would support a small editorial team like ours in the way you have.

You are allowing us to do what we love to do, which is tell stories about the gaming industry and bring you the latest news, exclusive information, and reviews that you need to know about. And because of your support, we’ve been able to plan out even more features and content for Premium and Premium Plus subscribers. More details on that will be coming shortly after the start of the new year!

Thank you again to everyone who’s visited the site, downloaded the app, shared our work, and joined our discussions.

Here’s to an even better 2026!

MOBILE APP

item.title: Best Games to Buy for Hardcore Gamers 2025
item.content:encoded:
The Holiday Season is almost here, and what better gifts to buy for your loved ones than new games? The most difficult people to buy gifts for are hardcore gamers, as the usual stuff just doesn’t cut it for them. You really need to give them games that let them sink their teeth in and present a real challenge. 

This Insider Gaming guide will highlight some of the best game gifts you can purchase for hardcore gamers. The list includes some of the most challenging titles in recent times, which will really test players’ mettle. 

Do check out Insider Gaming’s Holiday 2025 hub for the best deals on games, hardware, and more. 

Elden Ring

Let’s start with the big one itself, Elden Ring, the game of the year for 2022. FromSoftware has done wonders with this title, blending its unmatched Soulslike formula with a vast, expansive open world. Elden Ring also features Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, which gives you a lot more hours with new locations, bosses, and weapons. 

Bloodborne

Blooborne is a title for true soulslike players looking to take on one of the biggest challenges yet. However, it is exclusive to PlayStation 4, so players will not be able to play it on other platforms and will be restricted to the resolution and performance of previous-gen consoles when playing it on the PS5. At the same time, the fun a hardcore gamer will have with this title is unmatched. 

Cuphead

Cuphead is a classic run-and-gun action game, with a focus on platforming and boss battles. It is inspired by the cartoons of the 1930s. It features visuals and audio created with the same techniques of that era: traditional hand-drawn cel animation, watercolor backgrounds, and original jazz recordings. The game presents a real challenge for even hardcore gamers, and if it becomes too difficult, they can have a friend join them in local co-op. 

Sifu

Sifu is a third-person brawler that has intricate, kung-fu-based combat mechanics. There’s another innovative mechanic in the title, where the player ages every time they die, learning more in the process, but becoming weaker as well as time goes on. In this quest for revenge, players will have no allies, just countless enemies to battle across various environments, with only a mysterious amulet to save their lives (only for some time). 

Super Meat Boy

Super Meat Boy is an excellent pick for a holiday gift for gamers, as it features a lot of content that players can enjoy, and it is tough as nails. It features the old-school difficulty of classic NES titles like Mega Man 2, Ghosts’ n Goblins, and Super Mario Bros. 2 (the Japanese one). It also has over 300 levels across more than five chapters, with some struggle-worthy boss fights. 

Hollow Knight: Silksong

Hollow Knight: Silksong is the most recent game in the list and also an excellent purchase for hardcore gamers. It’s a soulslike metroidvania title where players indulge in lethal acrobatic combat. The game will put forth a real challenge with over 200 ferocious beasts to fight and more than 40 legendary bosses to take down. The game also includes a Steel Soul mode, which offers an even greater challenge. 

Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice

If you know anything about the soulslike genre, then you might have heard of Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice, and if the player hasn’t played this title, then there are few better games for hardcore gamers to take on. It is the game of the year for 2019, where you play as a one-armed wolf and dwell in cut-throat sword-based combat. The game takes place during 1500s Sengoku Japan, and players will have to use deadly prosthetic tools and powerful ninja abilities to blend stealth, vertical traversal, and visceral head-to-head combat. 

Lies of P

Lies of P is one of the newer soulslike games from Neowiz, but it is still a top choice for a gift for hardcore gamers. It also features the ‘Overture’ DLC, which has already won ‘Best Game Expansion’ at the Golden Joystick Awards 2025. The game is a reinterpretation of the classic tale of Pinocchio, where you play as a puppet created by Geppetto in the Belle Epoque era. 

Dark Souls Remastered

This 2018 title lets players experience the genre-defining game that started it all for soulslike titles. It features the 2011 game with upgraded visuals and 60 fps performance, making gameplay feel much smoother. It features a dark, deep universe where each ending becomes a new beginning, and the difficulty of this game is no joke. 

Demon’s Souls

Demon’s Souls is another PlayStation exclusive available only on the PS5, but it is still a solid gift for a hardcore gamer. The 2003 game for the PS3 has been entirely rebuilt from the ground up and masterfully enhanced for the current-gen consoles. This game will not only test the player’s reflexes but also their strategic decision-making. 

Which of these games do you think is the best holiday gift for a hardcore gamer? Leave a comment down below or share your thoughts in Insider Gaming Discord.

NOTE: Insider Gaming may earn an affiliate commission if you purchase items through links on Insider Gaming. Read more about affiliate commission here.

item.title: All Games Added To PlayStation Plus In 2025
item.content:encoded:
PlayStation Plus members have had a great year in 2025, getting hands-on with some real gems such as Cyberpunk 2077, Alan Wake 2, and more. For those unaware, PS Plus was divided into three tiers a few years ago: Essential, Extra, and Premium, with each tier offering more benefits.

PS Plus Essential provides players with access to free monthly games. PlayStation Plus Extra provides players access to a Game Catalog with PS5 and PS4 games, along with the Essential benefits. Lastly, Premium/Deluxe provides Extra and Essential benefits along with access to a Classics Catalog, game trials, and cloud streaming. All tiers offer players access to online multiplayer, discounts, and cloud storage.

Check out the list of games that were added to PS Plus across each month:

PlayStation Plus January 2025 Games

PlayStation Plus Essential

  • Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League | PS5 
  • Need for Speed Hot Pursuit Remastered | PS4
  • The Stanley Parable: Ultra Deluxe | PS4, PS5 

PlayStation Plus Extra and Premium/Deluxe

  • God of War Ragnarök | PS4, PS5 
  • Like a Dragon Gaiden: The Man Who Erased His Name | PS4, PS5 
  • Atlas Fallen: Reign Of Sand | PS5 
  • SD Gundam Battle Alliance | PS4, PS5 
  • Sayonara Wild Hearts | PS4
  • ANNO: Mutationem | PS4, PS5 
  • Orcs Must Die 3 | PS4, PS5
  • Citizen Sleeper | PS4, PS5
  • Poker Club | PS4

PlayStation Plus Premium/Deluxe

  • Indiana Jones and the Staff of Kings | PS4, PS5 
  • Medievil II | PS4, PS5 

PlayStation Plus February 2025 Games

PlayStation Plus Essential

  • Payday 3 | PS5 
  • High on Life | PS4, PS5 
  • Pac-Man World Re-Pac | PS4, PS5 

PlayStation Plus Extra and Premium/Deluxe

  • Star Wars Jedi: Survivor | PS4, PS5

  • SaGa Frontier Remastered | PS4

  • Mordhau | PS4, PS5

PlayStation Plus Premium/Deluxe

  • Patapon 3 | PS4, PS5
  • Dropship: United Peace Force | PS4, PS5
